sections.heading: Recognition of order modified in another stateIf a child support order issued by a tribunal of this state is modified by a tribunal of another state which assumed jurisdiction pursuant to the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act, a tribunal of this state:(1) May enforce its order that was modified
sections.text: Recognition of order modified in another stateIf a child support order issued by a tribunal of this state is modified by a tribunal of another state which assumed jurisdiction pursuant to the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act, a tribunal of this state:(1) May enforce its order that was modified only as to arrears and interest accruing before the modification;(2) May provide appropriate relief for violations of its order which occurred before the effective date of the modification; and(3) Shall recognize the modifying order of the other state, upon registration, for the purpose of enforcement.Acts 1995, No. 251, ยง1, eff. Jan. 1, 1996; Acts 1997, No. 1241, ยง1, eff. July 15, 1997; Acts 2015, No. 80, ยง1, eff. July 1, 2015.
